result.execSummary:
The defendant Gregory A Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Transcript - Hearing 9-28-2017

Defendant in court today w/Atty Teesch, hearing requested by Atty Teesch ref inability to pay. Testimony taken from defendant. Assist DA Nicholas Grode appeared for the State. Judge finds defendant physically able to work so had the ability to pay financial obligations to the court. Judge stays remaining commitment, orders defendant to be released, will need to start $100 per month payments within 30 days of release.
Hearing on September 28, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

Transcript - Hearing 4-21-2017
Appeared before Judge

Defendant in custody and appeared by video conference from the jail.  Currently owes $6,178.16 in fines, last payment made was in August 2015. Defendant started working a part-time job a couple of weeks ago and has a lead on a full-time landscaping job.  He currently has a couple hundred dollars to his name.  Judge states defendant has to pay at least $2,000.00 towards his fines in order to be released from custody and is ordered to pay a minimum of $200/month on his fines.  Defendant reiterates he has no money. He will sit his time (248 days). Judge asked for current address---defendant stated he "WAS" living at 1415 12th Avenue in Sheboygan and is looking for a new place.

from Atty Reetz indicating defendant is accepting the State's offer to resolve this matter.

Defendant Gregory A Brown in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Defendant Gregory A Brown in custody.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters alford plea to Ct. 3. Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty of Ct. 3. Court dismisses Cts. 1 & 2 but reads in for sentencing. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.

Defendant Gregory A Brown appears by video conference from the Sheboygan County Jail along with attorney Brett E Reetz who appears in court in person.  Defendant Gregory A Brown in custody.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Reetz indicates matter is not resolved, will be proceeding to trial. Court advises this matter is in the #1 position, will proceed to trial on 12/01/15. If matter resolves, court would like a plea before the trial date. Counsel may have to set that plea with Judge Diltz as Judge Ehlers not available the last 2 weeks in November. Bond remains in effect.

Court presents State's offer to defendant, wants to make sure defendant was advised of the offer and understands it. Defendant has seen offer and is still rejecting it. Court indicates this matter is in the #1 position, will proceed to trial on 8/05/15. Bond remains in effect.
